greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; for n > 1, a(n) = A297114(A156552(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4137
mathematica: Array[If[# == 1, 0, Function[n, DivisorSum[n, MoebiusMu[n/#] (2 # - DigitCount[2 #, 2, 1] - DivisorSigma[1, #]) &]]@ Floor@ Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 2^(#2 - 1) &, Flatten[Table[2^(PrimePi@ #1 - 1), {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ #]]] &, 90] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 11 2019 *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 05 2019
